subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... BBC Basic looked up names on the fly. [Hence the creation of utilities to strip the code, renaming variables and procedures and functions and removing
messageBody:
On Wednesday 24 September 2003 14:45, Ron Jeffries wrote:
> On Wednesday, September 24, 2003, at 9:07:09 AM, Jim Dixon wrote:
> > It's probably true in any interpreted language; it takes time to run
> > through strings. The longer the strings, the more time it takes.
>
> Jim, I mean this in the nicest possible way: I think you need to run a
> test.
>
> All the interpreted languages I know use symbol tables. The references in
> the byte code are resolved to indexes or pointers at compile time,
> generally not run time.

BBC Basic looked up names on the fly.

[Hence the creation of utilities to strip the code, renaming variables and
procedures and functions and removing irrelevant whitespace and keywords,
so that it would run faster.]

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
C FAQs at: http://www.faqs.org/faqs/by-newsgroup/comp/comp.lang.c.html
